page.title: 11Progress Road Estate.
page.content: The building of 2{gasometers}caused a number of protests among the residents of Eastwood in 1959. However, they marked the beginnings of a large and prosperous{industrial estate}that was to spring up in the next 20 years around Progress Road. Previously, the village of Eastwood had been surrounded by farms with the Bellhouse brickworks, owned by the Cornish family, its only industry. Today it is a thriving community, many of whose members came down from the London suburbs to buy new properties on the pleasant housing estates and to find work in the factories. The brickworks no longer exist, being replaced by the industries listed on the previous page. The Cornish family now runs a removal firm.
